intro: Phyllanthus melleri var. campenonii, commonly known as the Campenonii phyllanthus, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and distinctive leaves. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, well-drained soils.
